conclusion: The problem involves predicting which bottom container (D, E, F, or G) liquid from A, B, and C will flow into after passing through baffles.

Three colored liquids are released from containers at the top: A (white), B (green), and C (pink). The liquids flow down through a system of colored baffles/sticks to reach house-shaped containers at the bottom labeled D, E, F, and G.
The image shows a system with colored baffles: turquoise, red, yellow, white, and green, arranged diagonally, and house-shaped containers at the bottom labeled D, E, F, and G.
The white liquid from A flows downward and encounters the turquoise baffle, which diverts it to the left.
The white liquid continues flowing along the leftmost path and reaches the far-left container.
The white liquid from A flows into container D (leftmost container).
The green liquid from B flows straight down initially and touches the red baffle, which diverts it slightly.
The green liquid continues following a path through the center-right of the board and reaches the orange-colored house.
The green liquid from B flows into container F (the orange house).
The pink liquid from C flows downward from the right side and encounters the yellow baffle, which affects its path.
The pink liquid flows toward the center, interacts with multiple baffles, and eventually reaches the red baffle.
The pink liquid from C flows into container E (the pink house).
Final Answer: Liquid from A (white) → Container D, Liquid from B (green) → Container F, Liquid from C (pink) → Container E.
